item.title: Denver Action Network+21Denver CommunistsOur comrade(s) who infiltrated the Colorado Unorganized Constitutional Militia passed along their...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Action Network+21Denver Communists

Our comrade(s) who infiltrated the Colorado Unorganized Constitutional Militia passed along their Rules of Engagement slide deck. It is a vile, outlandish, and ...funny-if-it-wasn’t-scary document that details violent fantasies they desperately long to make real.

One thing this document makes clear: the far right is chomping at the bit to hurt Black Lives Matter protestors.

They hate the anti-racist rebellion that has gripped this country since cops murdered George Floyd. They hate to see oppressed people fight back. And they hate to see solidarity with the very groups they attempt to scapegoat.

These white-nationalist, patriot militia-types think cops aren’t repressing the movement violently enough, so they’re volunteering to do more. The Colorado Unorganized Constitutional Militia document, for instance, upholds Kyle Rittenhouse’s double-murder as an example that, “as patriotically awesome as it was to watch, we need to learn from.”

Right-wing vigilantism attempts to reinforce social inequality and uphold the status quo, not to subvert them. Historically, privatized and vigilante violence has been central to maintaining the racial and social order in the United States. Examples include the KKK, volunteer border patrols, the bosses’ private security forces, and white-on-Black race riots.

The militia’s violent fantasies transform cities like Denver into war zones. They claim that “not knowing where you are will get you killed,” as if there is danger inherent to urban neighborhoods. Playing to the fears of their mostly white, suburban and exurban, petit-bourgeois membership—the historic social base of fascism—helps motivate them toward violence.

The ultimate dream of these fascists is for their racist, rapist president to go beyond instructing them to “stand back and stand by” and give them the go-ahead to kidnap and kill protestors. They consider it an imminent possibility and they are actively making plans for that day.

Some highlights:

* The militia considers itself at “war with political driven [sic] Marxist groups.”

* The document is saturated with militaristic buzz words and concepts, like a chain of command and required combat gear.

* It details rules of engagement for “operating against BLM and Antifa,” which it refers to as “adversaries” and “enemies.”

* It instructs the militia to “be violent” and “shoot to kill, never to wound,” when they deem it justified via their pseudo-legalistic framework.

* It details what kinds of weapons to use, including pistols with at least 30 rounds and 9mm capacity, “long guns” in “mobile units,” knives, hard-knuckle gloves, and wasp spray.

* In addition to instructions to kill protestors, it suggests kidnapping them. For this purpose, militia members are instructed to carry zip ties and a “couple ripped up t-shirts for gags and blind folds.”

* It uses Trump’s racist phrase “China virus.”

* The document culminates in a bleak vision that demands the militia’s violent action. It claims the US is “entering into very dark times” when “patriots” are outnumbered and “under attack from Marxist [sic] that aim to destroy everything we have built.”

* It ends with the white-supremacist, neo-Nazi rallying cry, “Until Valhalla.” That’s an appropriate ending for a self-aggrandizing death cult.

Here’s the full document: https://gofile.io/d/dTxESt

item.title: Denver Action Network+7Denver CommunistsLast night in Denver, 500 marched for Breonna Taylor. As they have done all summer, members of the...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Action Network+7Denver Communists

Last night in Denver, 500 marched for Breonna Taylor. As they have done all summer, members of the PSL and Frontline Party for Revolutionary Action and Denver S...chool Board Director Tay Anderson told the protestors to go home before 9pm. Most complied.

Those who stayed gathered for some speeches and faced off with a hostile driver. The driver ended up plowing into the crowd and was briefly detained by police two blocks away. No one was injured.

Then we marched to the District 6 police station. Cops shot tear gas and protestors lobbed the canisters back at them. With our numbers so diminished, we were unable to maintain the march against police attack. Hastily-constructed dumpster barricades were no match for the truckloads of riot cops that shot pepperballs at us until we finally dispersed.

Justice for Breonna Taylor will not be won by compliance with the system that murdered her!

See More

item.title: #IndigenousPeoplesDayOfRage #IndigenousPeoplesDay #Solidarity
item.content:encoded:
Denver Action Network

#IndigenousPeoplesDayOfRage
#IndigenousPeoplesDay
#Solidarity

Indigenous Action is in Turtle Island.

This is a call for an Indigenous Peoples Day of Rage Against Colonialism on Sunday, October 11, 2020, everywhere.

We are calling for autonomous, anti-colonial, ...anti-capitalist, and anti-fascist actions. We will take the streets and we will take the waters and the forests. We will intervene in settler and resource colonial violence. We will defend our communities.
We envision this Day of Rage to be decentralized, filled with creative direct action (both above ground and below ground), daring, and with extraordinary diversity of tactics.

This could look like marches, occupations, blockades, street theater, it could look like anti-colonial messages spray painted on walls, it could look like monuments falling or going after resource colonial corporations and their machinery. It could look like hundreds of people or just a couple of people with a targeted action. What it looks like is really up to you. Check out our site for organizing resources for more info.

Organize and list or find an action here: www.indigenouspeoplesdayofrage.org

#indigenouspeoplesdayofrage
#indigenouspeoplesday

See More
item.author: Denver Action Network

item.title: Unconscionable & vile behavior from the Denver Police...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Action Network

Unconscionable & vile behavior from the Denver Police Department

We demand the names of these officers and we demand justice!
#ACAB

Michael Jacobs

As some of you may know, a few weeks ago I was at a protest in Denver when I was brutally assaulted by Denver Police Department, sexually assaulted, and thrown ...in Jail. Naturally, this was an extremely traumatizing event, and I preferred to spare the details from the world partly for privacy but mostly for shame. What they did to me was not only cruel and unusual, but I would even go so far as to call those men’s actions that night pure evil. But tonight I am forced to share with you all this in hopes you will stand in solidarity with me as I stand trial against felony charges that could land me years in prison. It would mean the world to me if you all could take a few minutes to read this and repost my story if you feel comfortable with that.

The reason I feel forced to share my story, or even share prematurely is because of the circumstances of this trial. The night of the protest I was arrested for “disarming a peace officer” - they say I stole a pepper ball gun from one of the officers. Disclaimer, I didn't… but I’ll get to that later - After being discharged from jail due to my deteriorating medical condition, I quickly found an excellent law firm to help represent me. Over the next 4 weeks, my legal team visited DPD twice a day, requesting all the evidence such as footage from a street surveillance camera, and the officer's body cams. When they did not comply, I turned to my friends in the political realm. After a few state legislators reached out on my behalf, for the most part we were met with silence. As privileged as I was to have these politicians advocating for me, DPD still would not budge. The only discovery presented by the police so far, 6 weeks after my arrest, is a probable cause statement-making claims that can be quickly and easily disproved by a video of the arrest that night, provided by a fellow protestor. In all the years my lawyers have been practicing in Colorado, they have never once seen evidence be withheld to such a degree. And with all the stories of shady arrests going down, it is honestly starting to scare me.

Unfortunately, now I know what a panic attack feels like. I now know the tight squeezing feeling that grips my chest, that the doctors call anxiety. The fact that I can't live without an irrational fear of being outside alone at night (something women have ALWAYS to deal with!!!!). The reason for this is because of the exact way the arrest went down that night. It was without any warning nor any chance to cooperate. I was grabbed from behind while I was standing, leaning against a fence. What happened next occurred in the blink of an eye. I was thrown to the ground face first. All of a sudden I started getting beaten by several officers, kicked and hit with a baton. I was grabbed by the hair on my scalp, my head was lifted off the ground, and I was punched multiple times in the face. My muffled screams for my girlfriend, for any help, were quickly snuffed out. Then an officer decided to take his baton, and forcibly shove it into my rectum. My “fight or flight, friend or freeze” instincts kicked in, and my body went numb. Everything that happened after that felt like a blur. I begged and pleaded for them to tell me what I had done wrong and why I was being arrested, but the only response I received was being told “We don’t gotta tell you SHIT… shut the FUCK up”

After spending the night in the hospital concussed and handcuffed to my gurney, I was finally thrown in jail. The worst of my charges: disarming an officer??? and violently resisting arrest?!? All absolutely untrue. I did not do it, and there is a video that shows all of this. My deepest gratitude goes out to the unnamed protestor who reached out with the video. I am not a violent man. Peace is my first language, anyone who knows me can tell you that.

These officers must face the law. I still don't even know the names of my assaulters. They remain anonymous, STILL ON DUTY. How long until they sexually assault another victim, or even murder someone. How long until another “hashtag”.

Please share this. If you feel comfortable, even share a short story, or some time you have personally witnessed the amount of love I pour into activism, and this community… I live to help. Tag Jared Polis. Tag Mayor Hancock. Tag DA Beth Mccann, DPD, tag em all. Community, I need you all now more than ever. I love you all. Thank you.

Link to video of arrest: https://streamable.com/3pn8wa

See More
item.author: Denver Action Network

item.title: Denver Action Network+12Denver CommunistsJustice for Antonio Blackbear! Last night, in a last-minute mobilization, 125 gathered with Antonio...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Action Network+12Denver Communists

Justice for Antonio Blackbear! Last night, in a last-minute mobilization, 125 gathered with Antonio Blackbear’s mother, wife, daughter, aunt, and other relative...s to protest his murder by Denver Police two days ago.

We began with an Indigenous prayer and remarks from family members, including Lynn Eagle Feather, Antonio’s hunka (adopted) aunt, whose son, Paul Castaway, was also murdered by Denver Police five years ago.

With friendly cars following us, we marched a mile from the Capitol Building past the downtown police headquarters and chanted “Cops! Pigs! Murderers!” at the cops guarding the fence they erected around it. We asked them, “Which one of you killed Antonio Blackbear?” and later, when we confronted some sheriff’s deputies, “Which one of you killed Michael Marshall?”

At the site of Antonio’s murder, family members gathered around a candle-filled memorial and told the crowd about their lost relative. Antonio’s mother expressed how touched she was by the presence of so many who were outraged by the shooting. It was painful to witness yet another family reeling from the shock of the police taking the life of their beloved relative.

The march returned to the Capitol and happened to pass a Starbucks along the way, the windows of which proved to be an irresistible temptation. After most of us had dispersed and gone home, two truckloads of riot cops advanced on those that remained. They were clearly coming for a couple of protestors and we were unable to prevent them from doing so. Two were arrested and won’t be able to be bailed out until Monday. Donations for bail can be made to Colorado Freedom Fund: https://fundly.com/coloradofreedom

Thank you to Antonio’s family, Native Lives Matter, Anon Resistance Movement, and all who showed up against racist police violence!

“When Indigenous lives are under attack, what do we do? Stand up, fight back!”

Tomorrow, Wednesday September 2nd, at 5:30 at Mestizo-Curtis park, there will be a teach in/workshop presented by Kerrie Joy covering navigating local city politics, and how we can change the power structures of the city. (Abolish the police!!)
Also, there will be free food! (Who doesn’t like free food??)

Denver Freedom Skool

Join us Wednesday, September 2nd, at 5:30 pm at Mestizo-Curtis Park for a teach in presented by Denver Activist Kerrie Joy of "Demystify the Technique" for a te...ach in on "bridging the gap" between direct action in the streets, and navigating city politics to change systems of power within the city.
Free food will be provided!

item.title: Denver Action Network+11Denver CommunistsOn the 57th anniversary of the March on Washington, a crowd of 250 gathered in Civic Center Park....
item.content:encoded:
Denver Action Network+11Denver Communists

On the 57th anniversary of the March on Washington, a crowd of 250 gathered in Civic Center Park. We sold some books, handed out some anti-police pamphlets, and... talked about communism with folks.

After a short march to the District 6 police station, protestors shook the temporary fencing around it a little. Denver Police drove us back with lots of pepperballs and teargas.

Then 30 militia-type fascists with shields, helmets, and batons approached from the opposite direction. We had heard they were coming.

Cops quickly wedged themselves between us, with their backs to the fash, of course. They formed a riot line and forced us back toward the Capitol, firing more pepperballs intermittently. We never saw the fascists again after the cops came to their rescue.

item.title: Please support & share! A Statement From The Fundraisers:...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Action Network

Please support & share!

A Statement From The Fundraisers:
"This bail fund is for #Denver demonstrators who were arrested on Saturday August 22, 2020 for confronting the Denver Police Department for what it is: a violently racist and authoritarian institution.

...

After years of police murder and the terrorizing our unhoused neighbors, we are FED UP! Last Wednesday, when 40+ DPD officers brutalized community members assisting unhoused neighbors with sweeps, we drew a line in the sand. Enough is enough!

We demand justice for our unhoused neighbors, as well as the families of William Debose, Alexis Mendez-Perez, Paul Castaway, Michael Marshall, Marvin Booker, Ryan Ronquillo, Jessie Hernandez and the thousands of people in our city impacted by state-backed violence. The Denver City Council has failed to hear our calls for justice, liberation and abolition. We know that human rights only come alive when citizens organize, protest, boycott, rebel and violate the law in order to uphold justice!

Twelve comrades were arrested last night. Some were released on PR bond but we still have 3 bonds of $500 each to pay and two comrades with bond not allowed until court on Monday afternoon. Please help raise the ransom for these brave rebels and get them out of cages with an active COVID outbreak! Let's get our comrades back to their loved ones, their pets and their jobs tonight!

As the election approaches, we are looking to make an active bail fund for rebels. Any excess monies will be put into this revolving fund as we work to create it! We will update this post when fundraising goals gave been met!

Solidarity & Power"
✊🏴🚩🔥
